prompt: <description>Part 1: Cylindrical Object with a Tapered Top and Bottom Construct a cylindrical object with a slightly tapered top and bottom, resembling a solid, three-dimensional shape. Begin by creating a new coordinate system at (0, 0, 0.25) with no rotation. 1. **Create a 2D Sketch on the XY-plane:** - Draw a circle centered at (0.25, 0.25) with a radius of 0.25. 2. **Scale the Sketch:** - Apply a uniform scale factor of 0.5 to the entire sketch. 3. **Transform the Sketch into 3D:** - Keep the original orientation (0, 0, 0) and translate the sketch along the Z-axis by 0.25 units. 4. **Extrude the Sketch:** - Extrude the sketch along its normal direction by 0.5 units. - Do not extrude in the opposite direction. - This operation will create a new solid body. Part 2: Central Hole Create a central hole that tapers towards the top of the cylindrical object. Begin by creating a new coordinate system at (0.175, 0.175, 0.75) with no rotation. 1. **Create a 2D Sketch on the XY-plane:** - Draw a circle centered at (0.075, 0.075) with a radius of 0.075. 2. **Scale the Sketch:** - Apply a uniform scale factor of 0.15 to the entire sketch. 3. **Transform the Sketch into 3D:** - Keep the original orientation (0, 0, 0) and translate the sketch along the Z-axis by 0.35 units. 4. **Extrude the Sketch:** - Only extrude in the opposite direction of the normal by 0.35 units. - This operation will remove or cut material from the existing body. Part 3: Central Hole Continuation Create the lower portion of the central hole, matching the height of the cylindrical object. Begin by creating a new coordinate system at (0.175, 0.325, 0.25) with an orientation of (0, 0, 180) about the Z-axis. 1. **Create a 2D Sketch on the XY-plane:** - Draw a circle centered at (0.075, 0.075) with a radius of 0.075. 2. **Scale the Sketch:** - Apply a uniform scale factor of 0.15 to the entire sketch. 3. **Transform the Sketch into 3D:** - Keep the original orientation (0, 0, 0) and translate the sketch along the Z-axis by 0.25 units. 4. **Extrude the Sketch:** - Extrude the sketch along its normal direction by 0.25 units. - This operation will add or join material to the existing body.</description>

prompt: <description>**Part 1: Construct a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The front face is angled at 45 degrees.** 1. Create a new coordinate system with the following parameters: * Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] * Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.1125, 0.0] 2. Draw a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the new coordinate system. 3. Create a rectangle using the following line segments: * Line 1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.75, 0.0] * Line 2: Start Point [0.75, 0.0], End Point [0.75, 0.75] * Line 3: Start Point [0.75, 0.75], End Point [0.0, 0.75] * Line 4: Start Point [0.0, 0.75], End Point [0.0, 0.0] 4. Close the loop and complete the sketch. 5. Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.75. 6. Transform the 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the euler angles and translation vector of the coordinate system. 7. Extrude the sketch along the Z-axis by 0.0375 units. **Part 2: Construct a cylindrical object with a smaller cylindrical hole through its center.** 1. Create a new coordinate system with the following parameters: * Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] * Translation Vector: [0.2437, 0.075, 0.3562] 2. Draw a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the new coordinate system. 3. Create a first circle with the following properties: * Center: [0.0188, 0.0188] * Radius: 0.0188 4. Create a second circle with the following properties: * Center: [0.3188, 0.0188] * Radius: 0.0188 5. Close the loop and complete the sketch. 6. Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.3375. 7. Transform the 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the euler angles and translation vector of the coordinate system. 8. Extrude the first circle along the Z-axis by 0.075 units. 9. Extrude the second circle along the Z-axis by 0.075 units, making sure it intersects with the first extrusion. **Final Shape: Construct a rectangular prism with two cylindrical holes on opposite sides.** 1. Combine Part 1 and Part 2 in a way that creates a rectangular prism with two cylindrical holes on opposite sides. This can be achieved by using the "JoinFeatureOperation" during the extrusion process of Part 2. The cylindrical holes will be subtracted from the rectangular prism. Additional details about the final shape: * Length: 0.75 * Width: 0.3375 * Height: 0.3375</description>

prompt: <description>**Intermediate Part 1: A Rectangular Prism with a Curved Top Edge and Two Holes** The first part of the assembly is a rectangular prism with a curved top edge and two holes on the top surface. The prism has a length of 0.75 units, a width of 0.75 units, and a height of 0.0288 units. Let's begin by creating a new coordinate system. **Step 1: Create a new coordinate system** Define the coordinate system with no rotation (euler angles: 0.0, 0.0, 0.0) and a translation vector of (0.0, 0.0, 0.0288). **Step 2: Draw a 2D sketch** Begin a new 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system. **Step 3: Sketch the rectangular prism** Draw the outline of the prism as follows: - Draw a line from (0.0, 0.6115) to (0.0462, 0.0923). - Draw an arc centered at (0.0732, 0.027) from (0.0462, 0.0923) to (0.1385, 0.0). - Draw a line from (0.1385, 0.0) to (0.6577, 0.0). - Draw an arc centered at (0.75, 0.0923) from (0.6577, 0.0) to (0.6577, 0.1846). - Draw a line from (0.6577, 0.1846) to (0.3146, 0.1846). - Draw an arc centered at (0.2636, 0.2071) from (0.3146, 0.1846) to (0.2457, 0.26). - Draw a line from (0.2457, 0.26) to (0.2769, 0.6115). - Draw an arc centered at (0.1385, 0.75) from (0.2769, 0.6115) to (0.0, 0.6115). The prism has one face with four lines and four arcs. **Step 4: Sketch the two holes** Draw the two circles representing the holes as follows: - Draw a circle centered at (0.1385, 0.0923) with a radius of 0.0462. - Draw a circle centered at (0.1385, 0.6115) with a radius of 0.0462. - Draw a circle centered at (0.6577, 0.0923) with a radius of 0.0346. The prism has another three faces (three circles) representing the holes. **Step 5: Scale and transform the 2D sketch** Scale the 2D sketch using a scaling parameter of 0.75 and transform the scaled sketch into a 3D sketch using the given euler angles and translation vector. **Step 6: Extrude the 3D model** Extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model with an extrusion depth of 0.0144 towards the normal and 0.0144 opposite the normal. The first part of the assembly is now complete. Continue with the next parts using similar step-by-step instructions.</description>

Extrusion Extrude the sketch using the following properties: * Extrude depth towards normal: 0.2562 * Extrude depth opposite normal: 0.0 * Sketch scale: 0.709 * Operation: Create a new solid body. Dimensions The length is 0.709 units, the width is 0.2562 units and the height is 0.709 units. Part 2 Instructions Shape Create a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The sides are parallel and the top and bottom faces are perpendicular to the sides. The dimensions of the sides are equal and the height is half the length of the sides. Sketch Draw a face and create a loop. 1. Draw the first line from the point [0.0, 0.0] to the point [0.75, 0.0]. 2. Draw the second line from the point [0.75, 0.0] to the point [0.75, 0.5924]. 3. Draw the third line from the point [0.75, 0.5924] back to the start point of the first line [0.0, 0.5924]. 4. Close the loop by drawing the fourth line from the point [0.0, 0.5924] back to the start point of the first line [0.0, 0.0]. Extrusion Extrude the sketch using the following properties: * Extrude depth towards normal: 0.2562 * Extrude depth opposite normal: 0.0 * Sketch scale: 0.75 * Operation: Join (add) this shape to the previously created parts. Dimensions The length is 0.2562 units, the width is 0.75 units and the height is 0.75 units. Final Assembly Combine Part 1 and Part 2 to form the final three-dimensional rectangular prism with a triangular cutout on one side. Ensure that the parts are aligned and fitted together as specified. The final shape's dimensions depend on how Part 1 and Part 2 have been constructed, but the length and width should be equal, and the height is the sum of both parts' heights.</description>
